title: English (1907) The Modern Readers Bible (Moulton)
description:
"The Modern Readers Bible," edited by Richard G. Moulton, is a unique presentation of the biblical text tailored for contemporary readers. Published in October 1907 by The Macmillan Company, this edition has undergone several reprints, signifying its popularity and utility. The compilation relies on The English Revised Version (1885) as its base text, offering readers a choice between the original readings and marginal notes, with minimal modifications for modern literary appeal.

Moulton's approach involves structuring the text to resonate with modern literary sensibilities while retaining the essence of the sacred writings. The layout varies between single and double columns, reflecting the importance Moulton assigns to different texts. Poetical books, in particular, are presented in a chromatic text form, enhancing their literary and aesthetic quality. In his six-page preface, dated June 1907, Moulton elaborates on his vision of making the Scriptures more accessible and relatable to the modern reader. This edition stands as a bridge between the time-honored reverence of the biblical text and the evolving literary tastes of contemporary society, offering a fresh perspective on the enduring words of the Bible.
